I used to troll killer, now i am one of the more entertaining killers youll go up against! that being said, i believe both killer and survivor are equally fun to play, given you get the right perks unlocked, even after the rework patch, there is still a feel for "crutch perks" tho i would say the category is broadened now.

Just to let you know in advance I am survivor main so this review is really only about playing survivor. Let's start with the good parts of this game. First things first this game is one of the most fun games to play with friends, if you can get a couple people to play with it's a blast. The mechanics of this game are great and there is a ton of outplay potential and mind games. It also has a huge cast of unique characters each with their own perks that can be taught to others. Now to get in to some VERY APPARENT ISSUES in this game that devs seem to just not give a fuck about. The hitreg in this game is some of the worst I have ever witnessed in a game. If you want to be able to even slightly enjoy playing DBD you are going to have to be ready to look past it. Another issue is that this game has a very toxic and braindead community. Your fellow survivors may leave the game after baby raging of getting his once, they may give away your position to killers or farm you cause they have nothing better to do with their life. The killers in your matches may also be unable to accept the fact that they suck at the game and ape rage by face camping you after you have been hooked. Lastly the devs do not care for the community at all. They simply don't patch huge bugs and they seem so disconnected from the community and what they want it's crazy. I had a friend who was wrongfully banned and the devs just didn't give a rats ass and ignored him. As well as another one of my friends losing all his progress on his characters out of nowhere and yet again ignored. I realize now at the end of this review that I wrote a lot of bad things about this game even though this is a positive review, but let it be known that if you can look past these issues the game is incredibly rewarding and tons of fun give it a try yourself.

Honestly as much as I tried to force myself to like this game it has become a fruitless effort for me and thus I decided to give my opinion as a new player on this game. The game starts out promising, showing you a bunch of killers with different special attacks and each one of them featuring a set of perks that help boost your experience as a ruthless murderer that strikes fear into the heart of the enemy... until you wake up. For the first 10-12 hours of the game most likely you will focus on the abilities and perks of both survivors and killers and try to have fun by playing your best as a newbie. After that you will start realising how lackluster and tedious the game becomes. Instead of playing for fun you will find yourself grinding for the best perk for either survivor or killer getting stuck in a META loop going on until you finally decide to give up on the game. If you thought the enjoyment lasts forever, I have to tell you it doesn't. Soon you will start realising how shit the matchmaking system is. As a rank 15 killer you will start being teamed up against survivors that are around rank 7 to 4 most of them being premade with their own noob friend. It's frustrating if not infuriating to wake up from that world of having fun to the crude reality that is DBD. A META enforced game with a toxic community and queues that can last for up to 15 minutes if you bought this game to play as a killer. Not only that but after a while you also realise how repetitive this game is: do generators, playing hot potato with a killer or keep looping around all generators to find and kill survivors ("kill" is generously used here considering that as a KILLER you rely on hooks to do your job unless you add an offering that is considered to be "toxic" cause it does its job). All in all I would give this game a 4/10 and I would recommend you buy it only if you have friends you can play survivor with.

Ele é um pouco pesado, mas dá pra rodar diminuindo os gráficos e a resolução, mesmo com isso o jogo vale muito a pena, tanto pra jogar sozinho quanto com amigos. DBD offers a rare balance of moods to play in. If you're feeling cooperative, play as a survivor. If you've got friends to have a good time with, play Survive with Friends. And if you're feeling like you need to blow off some steam and ruin someone's night by being a tunneling twit, play as killer.
